blocks.text: Authentication is the process of verifying that a user or system is who they claim to be. It occurs before access is granted to a resource.
Authentication factors include something you know, something you have, something you are, and sometimes where you are. Combining factors strengthens security.
Multifactor authentication requires at least two different factor types, reducing the risk of compromise when a single credential is stolen.
Authentication does not determine what actions a user may perform. That decision is handled by authorization.
